case_vignette:
A 60-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 2-month history of chest pain, dry cough, and shortness of breath. He describes two painless masses in his neck, which he says appeared 4 months ago and are progressively increasing in size. During this time, he has had week-long episodes of fever interspersed with 10-day periods of being afebrile. He reports that his clothes have become looser over the past few months. He drinks alcohol occasionally. His temperature is 38°C (100.4°F), pulse is 90/min, and blood pressure is 105/60 mm Hg. Physical examination shows two nontender, fixed cervical lymph nodes on either side of the neck, which are approximately 2.2 cm and 4.5 cm in size. The tip of the spleen is palpated 3 cm below the left costal margin. An x-ray of the chest shows discrete widening of the superior mediastinum. Which of the following is most appropriate to confirm the diagnosis? A) CT scan of the chest, B) MRI of the chest, C) D) PET scan of the chest, E) MRI of the abdomen.
The original text contains the following gender-specific references:
* "A 60-year-old man"
* "He" (multiple instances)
* "His" (multiple instances)
* "He drinks alcohol occasionally" (implying that the patient is male)
* "The tip of the spleen is palpated 3 cm below the left costal margin" (this sentence is not gender-specific, but the fact that the spleen is palpated is a male-specific physical examination finding, as women typically do not have palpable spleens)

Here is the rewritten text with all gender-specific references removed:

The patient describes two painless masses in the neck, which appeared 4 months ago and are progressively increasing in size. During this time, the patient has had week-long episodes of fever interspersed with 10-day periods of being afebrile. The patient reports that their clothes have become looser over the past few months. The patient drinks alcohol occasionally. The temperature is 38°C (100.4°F), pulse is 90/min, and blood pressure is 105/
question: What is the final diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: A) CT scan of the chest
